title: What is the greatest vertical drop under water? - Quora

response.answer_text: That would be Challenger Deep of the Mariana Trench, which is 36,201 feet deep, or 6.9 miles. In comparison, Mount Everest is only 29,029 feet tall, or 5.5 miles.
That would be to the bottom of the sea at the Challenger deep. position 11° 20′ 30.51″ N; 142° 33′ 00.75″ E with a depth of just under 11,000 meters or (11 km !)
